meanings.definition: The act of slowing down or reducing speed.
meanings.sent1: The decelerations of the car were noticeable as it approached the red light.
meanings.sent2: The decelerations of the train allowed passengers to safely exit at the station.
meanings.sent3: The decelerations of the snail were so extreme that it almost looked like it was moving backward.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt like it was experiencing decelerations as she waited for the exam results.
meanings.sent5: The decelerations of the waterfall created a mesmerizing display of grace and power.

meanings.definition: A decrease in the rate of speed.
meanings.sent1: The sudden decelerations of the roller coaster took everyone by surprise.
meanings.sent2: The decelerations of the airplane before landing made some passengers nervous.
meanings.sent3: The decelerations of the sloth were so gradual that it seemed to be standing still.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts experienced decelerations as he tried to focus on the task at hand.
meanings.sent5: The decelerations of the music tempo added a sense of suspense to the performance.
